Title: the junior professor solution

Sheldon: I recently read that during World War Two, Joseph Stalin had a research program to create supersoldiers by having women impregnated by gorillas.
Yeah, the correct animal for interspecies supersolider is koala. You would wind up with an army so cute it couldn’t be attacked.
The answer is cuddly soldiers with big flat noses. Moving on.
I’m sensing awkwardness, am I right?
Swish.
It was like the rest of the class wanted Ms. McDonald to forget the quiz.
(Knock, knock, knock) Mrs. Davis. (Knock, knock, knock) Guess who?
(Knock, knock, knock) That’s right, good job. Hello. Uh, you wanted to see me?
Thank you. I assume you’d like to reopen our dialogue about the university forcing me to continue with string theory?
That’s the one. I believe you went last, so, uh, please?
Wow. Pouting and running away actually worked. I must say, that may not be a lesson you want to reinforce with me. So, um, what is the solution?
But if I’m a professor, then I’ll have to teach a class.
So your solution is to promote me and pay me more money so that I can impart my knowledge to the next generation of scientists?
You people are sick.
Awful. They’re allowing me to move on from string theory, but they made me a junior professor and are requiring me to teach a class.
What a stupid question.
I can’t believe I have to waste my time babysitting a bunch of grad students who probably think dark matter is what’s in their diapers.
Wrong, Just because I enjoyed that one doesn’t mean I always do.
A valid point, but unoriginal. B-minus.
Yeah, well, of course I do. Listen to it. It’s like an earful of melted caramel.

It is true that many of my heroes have taken students under their wings. Feynman, Einstein, Professor X. Humorously, in the case of Professor X, some of his students actually had wings. That’s rich. I’ll use that one to lighten the mood after my entire class fails the midterm.
There is no class.
No one signed up.
I called the department secretary to see what happened. Apparently, I have a reputation for being obnoxious.
No, it’s fine. Now I can devote all my time to dark matter.

Oh, yes. Fig Newtons. I was going to ask them which scientist both helped to develop calculus and had a famous cookie named after him? And then after someone said Newton, I was going to tell them they’re wrong. The cookies are named after a town in Massachusetts. And then I’d throw the cookies away.
Why would you do that?
Oh, Howard. I appreciate the gesture, but this is a graduate-level physics class. I don’t think you’d understand a single thing I was talking about.
No.
How would you determine the ground state of a quantum system with no exact solution?
Hmm. Do you know how to integrate X squared times E to the minus X, without looking it up?
Okay. Um, what is the correct interpretation of quantum mechanics?
No.
You take that back.
I am trying to prepare my lesson plan for Howard. Why are you telling me this?
Amy, please. I am trying to figure out a way to intellectually emasculate a dear friend of mine.
Not now.
Oh, I’m working on my lesson plan for Wolowitz. He is going to be so lost. Look at this section over here. Even I don’t really understand it.
I’m a teacher, Leonard. It’s my job.
Oh, it’s no trouble, it’s actually a pleasure.

Interesting point. You’re suggesting that I have emotional issues below my consciousness which drive my behaviour, thus causing me to lash out at anything or anyone that threatens my intellectual superiority.
Leonard?
Howard’s allergic to peanuts. How can I use that against him?
Okay, now that everyone’s here, we can begin.
I suppose that’s a fair request. There’s no reason we both can’t benefit from this experience.
Okay. Well, then, uh, first things first. Um, are you familiar with the Brachistochrone problem?
Good. And how it relates to the calculus of variations?
Wonderful. Now, what about Euler-Lagrange theorems?

Ha! I knew it. All right. We have a lot of information to cover before your first test. Which, by the way, is in eight minutes. The good news is I’m grading on a curve, so you’re pretty much guaranteed a C.
What are you doing?
What are you doing?
Will you stop it. This is a classroom. This is not American Bandstand.
Now, where was I? Let’s see. Oh, yes. Over here. You… What are you doing now?
Why?
You’re not going to do that, and I’ll tell you why. This is an institution of higher learning, I am your professor, and you’re going to treat me with the prop… You shot your spit in my mouth!
Can’t talk. Spitball. Probably gonna die.
Well?
Are you sure? It just doesn’t feel as innocent as it used to.
You violated the sanctity of my mouth.
I told you you weren’t smart enough to take it.
Yeah, try me.
Young’s modulus.
Laminate the core material.
Oh! It’s not even Easter time. This is crazy.
Howard: What a sick use of science.
Yes, but when they’re hungry-hungry, you can stop them with marbles.
So, Penny, when’s the new job start?
Why is it your last name and her first name?
And you love the sound of your own voice.
Did you send everyone to the principal’s office already?
Hey, what if I took your class?
I’m thinking about getting my doctorate, and he wants to teach. Why not?
Sheldon, I’m more than smart enough to take your class.
Yes.
I would guess a wave-function and then vary its parameters until I found the lowest energy solution.
I’d use Feynman’s trick, differentiate under the integral sign.

Since every interpretation gives exactly the same answer to every measurement, they are all equally correct. However, I know you believe in the Many Worlds Interpretation, so I’ll say that. Now do you think I’m smart enough?
Oh, come on. You might’ve gone to school for a couple more years than me, but guess what, engineers are just as smart as physicists.
No.
Hey.

Before we do, I just talked to Leonard. And if you’re gonna spend all your time trying to belittle me by making this class unnecessarily hard, then I’m out. But if you’re interested in making a sincere effort to be a good teacher, then I’m willing to give this a shot.
Okay.
I am.
It’s an inverted cycloid.
That’s where I’m a little fuzzy.
If you’re gonna be a crappy teacher, then I’m gonna be a crappy student. (Singing) Uh, uh, Ludacris going in on the verse. ’cause I never been defeated and I won’t stop now…
Okay.
Making a straw.
So I can shoot you with a spitball.
Is that gonna be on the test? Because I don’t think I can do that again.
You reported me to human resources?
Well, I dropped your class, so I hope you’re happy.
I’m smart enough, Sheldon. Asking me a bunch of questions about a topic I’m not familiar with doesn’t prove anything. I could do the same to you.
Okay. You enjoy making fun of engineering so much, how do you quantify the strength of materials?
Yeah. Okay, how do you prevent eddy currents in a transformer?
That was a hard one. All right. How does the flow rate in a pipe depend on its diameter? You don’t know, do you? What’s the matter, smart guy? Don’t know Poiseuille’s law?
Okay, this one is for a Cadbury Creme Egg.
Which Archimedean solid has 20 regular triangular faces, 30 square faces, 12 pentagonal faces, 60 vertices and 120 edges?
Because we were awkward and weird and couldn’t play sports!
Raj: Hey, as long as the baby’s healthy.
So, I’ve been trying to come up with a cute couple’s nickname for me and Emily. What do you like better? Emippali or Koothrapemily?
Oh, well, her last name is Sweeney, and something just didn’t seem right about Koothrapeeney.
I don’t understand. Why is it bad that you have to teach?
Aw, you brought cookies for everyone?
Ask why not again, I’ve got an answer.
Why didn’t girls like us in high school?
Amy: I wonder if Stalin considered any other animals.
Yes.
Just give me a minute. I’m stimulating the pleasure cells of this starfish. I just need to turn it off.
Then I have to sit through lunch knowing this starfish is having a better day than I am. Is Bernadette meeting us at the restaurant?
How come?
Well, I think she just wants you to do well, and she’s worried that you won’t ’cause you were just a stunningly poor waitress.
I’m still waiting on my mini corndogs from two years ago.
Okay, so no Bernadette.
No, I just, I feel kind of uncomfortable talking about her like this. Usually when someone’s being talked about behind their back, it’s me and it’s right in front of my face.
I understand. You know, there is some research that indicates that sharing negative attitudes about a third party can be a powerful bonding force between two friends.
I’m saying, in the spirit of science, what is that little skank’s problem?
Measuring starfish serotonin levels in response to one point two molar stimulation of pleasure cells. You like that, don’t you? That’s right, say my name.
Hey, what’s going on?
No Penny?
Because you got her the job and you think she should be working harder to prepare for it?
I do, I see it.
That’s outrageous.
If she doesn’t do well, this could reflect poorly on you.
I don’t know. The important thing is I am here for you so we can mutually disparage this unpleasing third party.
So, after drinks with Bernadette, I get home, and Penny calls to complain about her. And then while I’m talking to Penny, I get a text from Bernadette.
Because it’s taken 15 years, but high school is finally awesome. I love them both, but I’m in the centre now, and I love that even more.
But I’m just…
You better watch that attitude, buddy. You’re dating the popular girl now.
Close enough. Um, I was just calling to see what you were up tonight. Thought maybe we could hit up Color Me Mine, maybe sneak in some Pinot Greej. Whatevs.
Oh. Oh, I hear you. Try and get that nag off your back, right? I mean, you’re not a bicycle, why’s she riding you like that?
Okay, good luck. And call me later, you know, if you decide she’s a bitch or something. Hey, girlfriend.
Tonight. You, me, Color Me Mine. Maybe we sneak in some Pinot, make it Color Me Wine.
Oh. Well, good luck getting her to do that. She’s probably off getting another manicure. You remember when she did that? You remember?
Oh. Great. I’m happy for you guys. You know, when the two of you aren’t getting along, it puts me in a really weird position.
You mean, like, where she’s nice to your face? Okay got it. Bye. Hey, boyfriend.
Leonard: Hippos are the deadliest creature. A half-human, half-hippo soldier would be pretty badass.
Mm, I don’t know. Who here has ever been hurt because they were the teacher’s pet?
Hey, how’d it go with human resources?
The kids are gonna love him.
This might not be that bad. Uh, you like telling people they’re wrong.
Look, most importantly, this will let you move on and study dark matter.
Hey. We just wanted to see how your class was going. Where is everybody?
Well, that’s not your fault.
What?
Yeah, why would you do that?
Hmm. You’re up late.
Sheldon, why are you doing this?
No, I mean, why are you going to so much trouble to prove that you’re smarter than Wolowitz?
You want to know what I think? I think the idea that someone could be as smart as you, or even smarter, scares the pants off you, and you can’t deal with it.
Might be something to think about.
Yeah.
Sheldon, I promise. Your uvula does not have an STD.
Come on, give him a hard one.
Okay, next question, for the Butterfinger. How long is a galactic yea
Yes. (Cheers)
We are so smart.
Right again. (Cheers)
Penny: Next Monday.
Uh, not yet, but I will.
I said I’ll get to it.
Well, the first few weeks will be all training. They’ll tell me everything I need to know.
Okay, so what, you want me to be like a teacher’s pet?
Hey. Ready to go to lunch?
What happens if you don’t?
Uh, no. Actually, I didn’t invite her.
Well, ever since she helped me get this job, she won’t stop bugging me.
That is not true.
I told you, they’ll be right out.
Well, you saw her the other night. Am I wrong?
I’m sorry. I just need a little break from her.
So, what are you saying?
What?
Uh, thanks, but I think I’m gonna stay in and go over the stuff Bernadette gave me.
No, I think she was just trying to help. Plus, I really want to do well at this job. So…
Headaches, dizziness and nausea.
Those are also the side effects of having a 75-year-old man with an erection climb on top of you.
Uh, no. I can keep going.
Okay, good. She seemed like she really wanted to go out tonight.
Bernadette: Did you get a chance to look over the materials I gave you?
I don’t want to be pushy, but you’ve never done pharmaceutical sales before. It seems like you could use this time to get a head start.
But imagine how impressed they’d be if you showed up already familiar with the material.
Not much. You want to get a drink later? Just the two of us?
Not tonight. I’m a little frustrated with her.
So it’s not just me. You see it, too.
It’s driving me crazy. Just this afternoon, I saw on Instagram that instead of studying, she went out to lunch and got a manicure.
Exactly. Does she not realize it or does she not care?
That sounds fun, but I promised Penny I’d come by and help her study.
I was probably being too hard on her. We talked, we’re good.
Well, don’t worry, everything’s back to normal.
Okay, what are the potential side effects for our erectile dysfunction drug?
Nah, you got this. Let’s go for a drink. I’ll call Amy.
Mrs Davis: You mean the dialogue that went, please, no, please, no, please, no.
Dr. Cooper, while you were away, we came up with a solution that would allow you to change your field of study.
Currently, you’re being paid under a grant to specifically research string theory. If we promote you to junior professor, you’ll be able to choose whatever field of research you’d like.
Howard (singing): All I do is win, win, win no matter what.
Everybody hands go up, up and they stay there!
Amy (on phone): Hey, girlfriend. Can I get a what what?
Sheldon (coughing several times): Thank goodness I got it. Now I can quit checking my stool.

Did you send everyone to the principal’s office already?
I called the department secretary to see what happened. Apparently, I have a reputation for being obnoxious.
No, it’s fine. Now I can devote all my time to dark matter.
Aw, you brought cookies for everyone?

Hey, what if I took your class?
Yeah, why would you do that?

Sheldon, I’m more than smart enough to take your class.

Okay. Um, what is the correct interpretation of quantum mechanics?

That’s where I’m a little fuzzy.

So I can shoot you with a spitball.

Those are also the side effects of having a 75-year-old man with an erection climb on top of you.
Uh, no. I can keep going.
Nah, you got this. Let’s go for a drink. I’ll call Amy.
Okay, good. She seemed like she really wanted to go out tonight.
Amy (phone ringing, running down stairs from outside Penny’s door)
